summary: Email chain from August 10-11, 2019, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's death and autopsy arrangements. Epstein's defense counsel requests a delay of the autopsy to allow a pathologist to be present, and federal prosecutors coordinate on the issue.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy discussion; his counsel is requesting to have a pathologist present at his autopsy.

persons.name: Miller
persons.context: Correspondent who emails on behalf of Epstein's defense team, requesting a delay of the autopsy to arrange for a pathologist.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Addressed in the email; appears to be a point of contact for the defense team regarding the autopsy and investigation.

persons.name: Marty
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain among legal contacts.

persons.name: Reid
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain among legal contacts.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain, likely part of Epstein's legal team.

persons.name: Weingarten
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain among legal contacts.

connections.description: Miller is acting on behalf of Epstein's defense team, requesting a delay in the autopsy for Epstein.
Weinberg is included in the legal correspondence regarding Epstein's case and autopsy.
Miller contacts Mike, a prosecutor or official, to request a delay in Epstein's autopsy.

events.title: Epstein's death and autopsy planning
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has died, and his defense counsel requests to delay his autopsy to arrange for a pathologist to be present.

events.title: Email coordination on autopsy
events.description: Email chain continues discussing the autopsy delay request and investigation into Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense counsel requested a delay of his autopsy to arrange for a pathologist to be present, indicating concerns about the autopsy process.
The email chain shows coordination between Epstein's legal team and federal prosecutors immediately following his death.
The correspondence reveals the defense's proactive efforts to have independent observation of the autopsy, suggesting potential disputes over the cause of death.
The emails are dated August 10-11, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death in custody.
